summary: The Tropical Plant Health Initiative Act (S. 2897) aims to amend the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990. It proposes research and extension grants to study and combat insects and pests affecting tropical plants. The bill focuses on developing tools and treatments, establishing pest management programs, surveying plant health, and investigating biological factors. It includes specific tropical plants like coffee, macadamia, and cacao, and amends the authorization of appropriations within the original act.
